xsl:call-template.xsl:with-param:
Reduces the movement costs of roads in all eras. In early eras this makes the choice of which roads you build have a more meaningful impact. In the late game reduced road costs enable armies to more quickly respond to your needs - either in attack or defense.
* Ancient roads continue to cost 1 movement point per hex, regardless of terrain. * Classical roads changed from 1 to 0.5 movement points per hex to make the impact of early roads more meaningful. * Industrial roads changed from 0.75 to 0.333 movement points to simulate the impact of faster forms of transportation (primarily railroads). * Modern roads changed from 0.5 to 0.25 movements points per hex.
